DIALOGUE.SPEECH: Hmm, the notification I got said that the next class will be in the Command Center.
It should be somewhere along this corridor...
Ah, here it is!

Not long ago, he was a student of the Academy, just like you.
In this class, you learn more about the Source Academy, a massive space station that also functions as a ship.

DIALOGUE.SPEECH: So, if you all did your research, you should know that the Grandmasters chose to settle in the Kepler-62 system because the planets nearby are one of the few that possess the Source in solid form – Source Crystals, after which the Crystal Order is named.

But sir, don’t we have functioning life-detection scanners?
Every year, I get asked the same question...

Yes, we do. And obviously we would have used them if that were an option, but the sheer power of these raw Source Crystals block out many of our instruments. Which is a total pain in our posterior, but there isnt' really anything we can do about it.

SEQUENCE.NARRATION: Pixel nudges you with her elbow.

DIALOGUE.SPEECH: Is he always like that?
I heard the cadets have a nickname for him. Navigator "Grouch".

SEQUENCE.NARRATION: The two of you start to snicker uncontrollably. The navigator shoots you a death glare.
You immediately stop and try to pull on a straight face. Struggling with every fibre of your being to not burst out in laughter.
After several more less interesting classes, the day ends.
You collapse on your bed, exhausted.

DIALOGUE.SPEECH: This is all so much to take in.
I wonder if I’ll ever get used to life like this? All the students and Stewards here look so busy and hardworking.
Who knows? Maybe one day I’ll be a Steward too!
Maybe even a Master?
Guess I should go to sleep before I get too carried away.

SEQUENCE.NARRATION: Instead of birds chirping outside your window, you wake to the sound of a blaring alarm from your academy-issued wrist device.

DIALOGUE.SPEECH: What is that racket?

Since yesterday went so smoothly, we can go a little faster today, I presume?

It’s not as hard as it sounds. Most of the techniques involved, you already know from the last class.
Everyone, get to your desks!

DIALOGUE.SPEECH: I finally finished!
